verses.verse: These also are proverbs <S%H4912><s%> of Solomon, <S%H8010><s%> which the men <S%H582><s%> of Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> copied out. <S%H6275><s%>

It is the glory <S%H3519><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> to conceal <S%H5641><s%> a thing, <S%H1697><s%> but the glory <S%H3519><s%> of kings <S%H4428><s%> is to search out <S%H2713><s%> a matter. <S%H1697><s%>
As the heavens <S%H8064><s%> for height, <S%H7312><s%> and the earth <S%H776><s%> for depth, <S%H6011><s%> so the hearts <S%H3820><s%> of kings <S%H4428><s%> are unsearchable. <S%H2714><s%>
Take away <S%H1898><s%> the dross <S%H5509><s%> from the silver, <S%H3701><s%> and material <S%H3627><s%> comes out <S%H3318><s%> for the refiner; <S%H6884><s%>
Take away <S%H1898><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> from the king <S%H4428><s%>'s presence, <S%H6440><s%> and his throne <S%H3678><s%> will be established <S%H3559><s%> in righteousness. <S%H6664><s%>
Don't <S%H1921><s%> exalt yourself in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the king, <S%H4428><s%> or claim <S%H5975><s%> a place <S%H4725><s%> among great men; <S%H1419><s%>

for it is better <S%H2896><s%> that it be said <S%H559><s%> to you, <S%H5927><s%> "Come up here, <S%H8213><s%>" than that you should be put lower in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the prince, <S%H5081><s%> whom your eyes <S%H5869><s%> have seen. <S%H7200><s%>

Don't <S%H4118><s%> be hasty in bringing <S%H3318><s%> charges <S%H7378><s%> to court. <S%H6213><s%> What will you do in the end <S%H319><s%> when your neighbor <S%H7453><s%> shames you? <S%H3637><s%>
Debate <S%H7378><s%> your case <S%H7379><s%> with your neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> and don't <S%H1540><s%> betray the confidence <S%H5475><s%> of another; <S%H312><s%>
lest one who hears <S%H8085><s%> it put you to shame, <S%H2616><s%> and your bad reputation <S%H1681><s%> never depart. <S%H7725><s%>
A word <S%H1697><s%> fitly <S%H212><s%> spoken <S%H1696><s%> is like apples <S%H8598><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%> in settings <S%H4906><s%> of silver. <S%H3701><s%>

As an earring <S%H5141><s%> of gold, <S%H2091><s%> and an ornament <S%H2481><s%> of fine gold, <S%H3800><s%> so is a wise <S%H2450><s%> reprover <S%H3198><s%> to an obedient <S%H8085><s%> ear. <S%H241><s%>

As the cold <S%H6793><s%> of snow <S%H7950><s%> in the time <S%H3117><s%> of harvest, <S%H7105><s%> so is a faithful <S%H539><s%> messenger <S%H6735><s%> to those who send <S%H7971><s%> him; <S%H7725><s%> for he refreshes the soul <S%H5315><s%> of his masters. <S%H113><s%>
As clouds <S%H5387><s%> and wind <S%H7307><s%> without rain, <S%H1653><s%> so is he <S%H376><s%> who boasts <S%H1984><s%> of gifts <S%H4991><s%> deceptively. <S%H8267><s%>
By <S%H753><s%> patience <S%H639><s%> a ruler <S%H7101><s%> is persuaded. <S%H6601><s%> A soft <S%H7390><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> breaks <S%H7665><s%> the bone. <S%H1634><s%>
Have you found <S%H4672><s%> honey? <S%H1706><s%> Eat <S%H398><s%> as much as is sufficient <S%H1767><s%> for you, <S%H7646><s%> lest you eat too much, and vomit it. <S%H6958><s%>
Let your foot <S%H7272><s%> be seldom <S%H3365><s%> in your neighbor <S%H7453><s%>'s house, <S%H1004><s%> lest he be weary <S%H7646><s%> of you, <S%H8130><s%> and hate you.

A man <S%H376><s%> who gives <S%H6030><s%> false <S%H8267><s%> testimony <S%H5707><s%> against his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> is like a club, <S%H4650><s%> a sword, <S%H2719><s%> or a sharp <S%H8150><s%> arrow. <S%H2671><s%>
Confidence <S%H4009><s%> in someone unfaithful <S%H898><s%> in time <S%H3117><s%> of trouble <S%H6869><s%> is like a bad <S%H7465><s%> tooth, <S%H8127><s%> or a lame <S%H4154><s%> foot. <S%H7272><s%>

As one who takes away <S%H5710><s%> a garment <S%H899><s%> in cold <S%H7135><s%> weather, <S%H3117><s%> or vinegar <S%H2558><s%> on soda, <S%H5427><s%> so is one who sings <S%H7891><s%> songs <S%H7892><s%> to a heavy <S%H7451><s%> heart. <S%H3820><s%>
If your enemy <S%H8130><s%> is hungry, <S%H7457><s%> give him food <S%H3899><s%> to eat. <S%H398><s%> If he is thirsty, <S%H6771><s%> give him water <S%H4325><s%> to drink: <S%H8248><s%>
for you will heap <S%H2846><s%> coals of fire <S%H1513><s%> on his head, <S%H7218><s%> and Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> will reward you. <S%H7999><s%>
The north <S%H6828><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> brings forth <S%H2342><s%> rain: <S%H1653><s%> so a backbiting <S%H5643><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> brings an angry <S%H2194><s%> face. <S%H6440><s%>

It is better <S%H2896><s%> to dwell <S%H3427><s%> in the corner <S%H6438><s%> of the housetop, <S%H1406><s%> than to share <S%H2267><s%> a house <S%H1004><s%> with a contentious <S%H4079><s%> woman. <S%H802><s%>
Like cold <S%H7119><s%> water <S%H4325><s%> to a thirsty <S%H5889><s%> soul, <S%H5315><s%> so is good <S%H2896><s%> news <S%H8052><s%> from a far <S%H4801><s%> country. <S%H776><s%>

Like a muddied <S%H7515><s%> spring, <S%H4599><s%> and a polluted <S%H7843><s%> well, <S%H4726><s%> so is a righteous <S%H6662><s%> man who gives <S%H4131><s%> way before <S%H6440><s%> the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>
It is not good <S%H2896><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> much <S%H7235><s%> honey; <S%H1706><s%> nor is it honorable <S%H3519><s%> to seek <S%H2714><s%> one <S%H3519><s%>'s own honor.
Like a city <S%H5892><s%> that is broken down <S%H6555><s%> and without walls <S%H2346><s%> is a man <S%H376><s%> whose spirit <S%H7307><s%> is without restraint. <S%H4623><s%>
